info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 7:26AM CDT until March 30 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Smith County in northeastern Texas... Northwestern Marion County in northeastern Texas... Southwestern Cass County in northeastern Texas... Northwestern Harrison County in northeastern Texas... Upshur County in northeastern Texas... Southern Morris County in northeastern Texas... Southeastern Camp County in northeastern Texas... * Until 815 AM CDT. * At 725 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Newsome to Rosewood to 7 miles south of Big Sandy, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Gladewater, Gilmer, Daingerfield, Hughes Springs, Lone Star, Big Sandy, Ore City, East Mountain, Diana, Rosewood, Jenkins, West Mountain, Cedar Springs, Avinger, Union Grove, Midway, Holly Springs, Lafayette, Center Point and Bettie. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for northeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for northeastern Texas.
